description:
1 - Have the "wad" files (Doom.wad or doom2.wad);
2 - Place the "wad" files in the following folder: "/home/(usuário)/.var/app/org.zdoom.GZDoom/.config/gzdoom/"
3 - Open the "gzdoom" file in the folder: "/home/(usuário)/.var/app/org.zdoom.GZDoom/.config/gzdoom/"
4- Edit the "gzdoom" file in the location "[IWADSearch.Directories]" and add the path: "Path=/home/(user)/.var/app/org.zdoom.GZDoom/.config/gzdoom/"
5 - Play
summary: How and where to place WAD files!

description: The wad folder /home/{user}/.var

To configure your wad directories, first give the Flatpak filesystem permissions, you can do --filesystem=host. Easy way to set this up is to just install Flatseal, which will let you manage permissions on all flatpaks. Afterwards, run gzdoom and it will now put a new config file in: ~/.config/gzdoom/gdzoom.ini
You can set your configurations in that file and you will be good to go.

description:
GZDoom is a great program! However, the flatpak implementation of it is broken by default and produces a "Cannot find gzdoom.pk3!" error after installation.

After about 2 hours of hassle, I discovered a workaround. The file in question is installed in "/var/lib/flatpak/app/org.zdoom.GZDoom/current/active/files/share/games/doom/gzdoom.pk3" There are two problems here: 1) GZDoom does not by default look for game files in this directory, and 2) flatpak does not give it read permissions for this directory by default.

Copying the "/var/lib/flatpak/app/org.zdoom.GZDoom/current/active/files/share/games/doom/" to "~/.local./share/games/" fixes problem #1 and allowing read/write access to All User Files in the Flatpack Permissions Settings (On my system this is accessed via System Settings > Applications) fixes problem #2.

Having to do this manually after install is completely unacceptable. The problem is not with GZDoom, it is entirely with the way flatpack decides to install GZDoom. How they could have made such a basic oversight I do not know, but they need to get it fixed!

If the Steam Deck controls issue got sorted, I would update this to a 5-star review.
